meanings.definition: A person who joins with another in sponsoring something.
meanings.sent1: My friend became a cosponsor of the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The cosponsor of the event helped raise funds for a good cause.
meanings.sent3: The cosponsor and the main sponsor had a friendly competition to see who could gather more donations.
meanings.sent4: Being a cosponsor is like being a teammate in supporting a cause.
meanings.sent5: The cosponsor's role is crucial in ensuring the success of the event.

meanings.definition: To sponsor or support jointly with another person or group.
meanings.sent1: I will cosponsor the project with my colleague.
meanings.sent2: They decided to cosponsor the event to maximize their impact.
meanings.sent3: The two companies cosponsoring the concert made sure to promote it together.
meanings.sent4: Cosponsoring the initiative will help us reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent5: We should cosponsor more events to strengthen our partnership.
